action.action-desc: Mr. Garbarino (for himself, Mr. Connolly, and Mr. Fitzpatrick) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To amend title 5, United States Code, to include certain Federal positions within the definition of law enforcement officer for retirement purposes, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Law Enforcement Officers Equity Act.

section.header: Including certain positions within the definition of law enforcement officer for purposes of retirement

subsection.text: Section 8401(17) of title 5, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking subparagraph (A) and (B) and inserting subparagraphs (A), (B), (E), (F), (G), (H), and (I); and
by striking and at the end; and

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: an employee not otherwise covered by this paragraph—

clause.text: the duties of whose position include the investigation or apprehension of individuals suspected or convicted of offenses against the criminal laws of the United States; and
who is authorized to carry a firearm;

subparagraph.text: an employee of the Internal Revenue Service, the duties of whose position are primarily the—
an employee of the United States Postal Inspection Service;
an employee of the Department of Veterans Affairs who is a Department police officer under section 902 of title 38; and
an employee of U.S. Customs and Border Protection—

clause.text: who is a seized property specialist in the GS–1801 job series; and
the duties of whose position include activities relating to the efficient and effective custody, management, and disposition of seized and forfeited property;

subsection.text: Section 8331(20) of title 5, United States Code, is amended, in the matter preceding subparagraph (A)—

paragraph.text: by inserting and an individual described in any of subparagraphs (E) through (I) of section 8401(17) after United States; and
by striking this activity and inserting such activity or described in any such subparagraph.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to any—

paragraph.text: individual who is appointed as a law enforcement officer—

subparagraph.text: as defined in section 8331(20) or 8401(17) of title 5, United States Code (as amended by this section); and
on or after the date of enactment of this Act; and

paragraph.text: incumbent (as defined in section 3(a)(3)), consistent with the requirements of section 3.
the term Director means the Director of the Office of Personnel Management;
the term Fund means the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund;
the term incumbent means an individual who—

subparagraph.text: was appointed as a law enforcement officer before the date of enactment of this Act; and
is serving as a law enforcement officer on the date of enactment of this Act;

paragraph.text: the term law enforcement officer means an individual who satisfies the requirements of section 8331(20) or 8401(17) of title 5, United States Code, by virtue of the amendments made by section 2;

the term prior service means, with respect to an incumbent who makes an election under subsection (b)(2), service performed by the incumbent before the date on which appropriate retirement deductions begin to be made under the election; and
the term service means service performed by an individual as a law enforcement officer.

subsection.header: Treatment of service performed by incumbents

paragraph.header: Service on or after date of enactment
paragraph.text: Service performed by an incumbent on or after the date of enactment of this Act shall be treated as service performed as a law enforcement officer.

Service performed by an incumbent before the date of enactment of this Act shall, for purposes of subchapter III of chapter 83 and chapter 84 of title 5, United States Code, be treated as service performed as a law enforcement officer only if the incumbent submits a written election to the Director by the earlier of—

subparagraph.text: the date that is 5 years after the date of enactment of this Act; or
the day before the date on which the incumbent separates from the service.

paragraph.text: An incumbent who makes an election under subsection (b)(2) may, with respect to prior service performed by the incumbent, pay a deposit into the Fund equal to the sum of—

clause.text: the amount that would have been deducted during the period of prior service under section 8334 or 8422 of title 5, United States Code, from the pay of the incumbent if the amendments made by section 2 had been in effect during the prior service; and
the amount that was deducted during the period of prior service under section 8334 or 8422 of title 5, United States Code; and

subparagraph.text: interest on the amount described in subparagraph (A)(i), as computed under—

clause.text: paragraphs (2) and (3) of section 8334(e) of title 5, United States Code; and

paragraph.text: If an incumbent does not pay the full amount of the deposit described in paragraph (1), all prior service of the incumbent—

subparagraph.text: shall remain fully creditable as a law enforcement officer; and
the resulting annuity shall be reduced—

clause.text: in a manner similar to that described in section 8334(d)(2) of title 5, United States Code; and
to the extent necessary to make up the amount unpaid.

paragraph.text: If an incumbent makes an election under subsection (b)(2), an agency that employed the incumbent during any prior service of the incumbent shall remit to the Director, for deposit in the Fund, an amount equal to the sum of—

clause.text: the total amount of Government contributions that would have been paid under section 8334 or 8423 of title 5, United States Code, if the amendments made by section 2 had been in effect during the prior service; and
the total amount of Government contributions paid under section 8334 or 8423 of title 5, United States Code; and

subparagraph.text: interest on the amount described in subparagraph (A)(i), as computed in accordance with—

clause.text: paragraphs (2) and (3) of section 8334(e) of title 5, United States Code; and

paragraph.text: Government contributions under this subsection on behalf of an incumbent shall be made by the agency ratably (not less frequently than annually) over the 10-year period beginning on the date described in subsection (a)(5).

subsection.text: Notwithstanding section 8335(b) or 8425(b) of title 5, United States Code, a law enforcement officer shall not be subject to mandatory separation during the 3-year period beginning on the date of enactment of this Act.

The Director shall prescribe regulations to carry out this Act, including regulations for the application of this section in the case of any individual entitled to a survivor annuity (based on the service of an incumbent who dies before making an election under subsection (b)(2)), to the extent of any rights that would have been available to the decedent if still living.
Nothing in this section shall be considered to apply in the case of a reemployed annuitant.
